intro: Mesosphaerum karstenii, commonly known as the Karsten's mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Mesembryanthemaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in succulent gardens.
